text: Inhibition of tumor development in <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice .
A-C , Tumor images , volumes , and weights .

B16 melanoma cells ( 5x105 cells / mouse ) were inoculated s.c . into <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / + mice and <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice ( n = 20 ) .
Tumor volumes were measured every day and tumor weights were measured at study termination ( Day 31 ) .

The <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice had a significant reduction in tumor growth and volume as compared to <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / + mice .
The results are expressed as mean +/- SD .
* indicates significant difference from <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / + mice ( P < 0.05 ) .

D , The <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - / - mice demonstrated significantly higher survival rates compared to <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / + mice ( by Log-rank Test ) .
E . Tumor sections were analyzed by H & E stain and expression of proliferating cell nuclear antigen ( PCNA ) by immunohistochemistry .
Data are means +/- S.D . of four experimental animals .
* indicates significant difference from <extra_id_0> CCR5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + / + mice ( P < 0.05 ) .
